name: Body
content:
# Body

The` <body>` tag defines the main content of the HTML document that will be directly visible on your web page. This body tag ` <body>` contains all the content of an HTML document, such as headings, paragraphs, images, hyperlinks, tables, lists, etc.

examples.description: Using `<body>` to create a simple webpage.
examples.code:
``` Title of the document

This is a heading

This is a paragraph.

```

short_description:
Body
The <body> tag defines the main content of the HTML document that will be directly visible on your web page. This body tag  <body> contains all the content of an HTML document, such as headings, paragraphs, images, hyperlinks, tables, lists, etc.
tips:
* There is *only* one `<body>` element in an HTML document.
* The  `<body>` tag should be placed under the closing `</head>` tag.
* All the contents of an HTML document, such as headings, images, lists, etc should go inside the `<body>` tag.
* No content should be written after the closing `</body>` tag.
